column4: Hey Guys. The sound just stopped on my Gutsy, It says the resource is busy, how do I refresh it or make it unbusy?
Throw a brick at it!  It won't be so f**cking busy then will it?  No, go into your sound prefs and then click reset sound server.  Wait, are you in Gnome or Kbuntu?
GNOME
OK.  Go into prefs > sound and note down what it is set to for your selected sound.  Then switch the sound to OSS mode, then back to the one that you noted.  See how that goes....
Nothing...After I did it I clicked test and it says "audiotestsrc wave=sine freq=512 ! audioconvert ! audioresample ! gconfaudiosink: Resource busy or not available."
Strange.  I've never come across that problem.  Keep asking, perhaps someone else has.
Thanks
Go into the sound settings again, but when you click OSS, click OK as though you are going to keep the setting.  Then come back in, and select the default.  See if that works...
Still nothing
I'll have a look around, give me a min or two...
Thanks
If you change the permissions on the /dev/dsp and /dev/audio devices to 666 it seams to fix the problem. My problem started after I used EasyUbuntu.  http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=325428
How would I go about doing that?
I have no idea, I was hoping you knew that part.  Let me go into dev/dsp and have a look...
Thanks
I don't think this is the way that we should go actually.  This fix does not work for everybody by the looks of it.  Let me look for an alt.
Thanks

Have you got easyubuntu installed?  Not that it matters, because it seems that there is no promising fix for this problem.  I would stick around and ask for a while.  Hopefully somebody will have a fix for it....
No, not EasyUbuntu. Is it software?
No, it's a cut down version of Ubuntu as far as I know.  Like xubuntu...
Ah.
